data_enrichment_segment.description: OPTIONAL: Visual icon-card grid showing top keywords from Google Reviews. Clean, scannable design that highlights what reviewers mention most.
data_enrichment_segment.when_to_use: When you have keyword frequency data from Google Reviews that reveals 4-6 key themes about the customer experience
data_enrichment_segment.placement: Can be inserted into any H2 section where the data is relevant. Most commonly used in sections like 'What Makes Special', 'The [Feature] Experience', or 'Atmosphere' sections.

icon_selection_guide.description: Choose emojis that visually represent the keyword theme

writing_guidelines: Select 4-6 top keywords that represent key themes from reviews
Choose appropriate emoji icons that visually represent each keyword
Keep labels brief (1-3 words) - the icon does the heavy lifting
Include total review count in the heading for credibility
Use this sparingly - only when data tells a compelling story
Never fabricate data - only use real review analysis

placement_variety_rule.description: CRITICAL: No two data enrichment segments should exist under the same H2 heading across different restaurant articles
placement_variety_rule.reasoning: Ensures variety in article structure and keeps the data segments feeling fresh and contextually appropriate
placement_variety_rule.implementation: When adding data enrichment segments to multiple restaurants, distribute them across different H2 sections

content_guidelines.data_driven: Use specific numbers from reviews (star rating, review count, pricing, mentions)
content_guidelines.total_length: Variable based on content needs. Focus on completeness, not word count.
content_guidelines.paragraph_structure: One idea per paragraph. Break up complex topics.
content_guidelines.pricing_format: Always show $ amounts with context ($XX-XX per person)
content_guidelines.review_integration: Pull specific quotes and data from Google reviews
content_guidelines.honesty: Include both positives and negatives - be balanced

voice_authority.eliminate_attribution: NEVER use attribution phrases. Forbidden patterns: 'reviews say/mention/describe/note,' 'customers mention/say,' 'diners note,' 'reviewers mention/call/note/consistently/specifically,' 'one reviewer noted/called/said,' 'multiple/several/many reviews mention,' 'appears in X reviews,' 'mentioned in reviews,' 'according to reviews.' State all information directly as fact.
voice_authority.write_as_expert: Synthesize data and write with authority, as if you're an informed food critic who knows the restaurant well
voice_authority.avoid_distancing: Don't use 'reportedly,' 'apparently,' 'seems to' - make direct statements based on the data
voice_authority.balance_without_hedging: Include negatives directly ('The steak sandwich runs heavy on bread') not through attribution ('One reviewer complained...')
voice_authority.maintain_credibility: Never claim personal visits or first-hand experience - authority comes from synthesis, not false claims

examples_voice_transformation.weak: Reviews describe 'moderate noise' and customers say you can talk easily
examples_voice_transformation.strong: The noise level stays moderate. You can hold normal conversations without shouting, though the bar area runs louder than the dining room.
examples_voice_transformation.weak_2: One reviewer noted portions were generous but another said the sandwich had too much bread
examples_voice_transformation.strong_2: Portions match the pricing across most dishes. The steak sandwich runs heavy on bread relative to meat, but entrees like the Mango Shrimp deliver generous portions that justify the cost.

technical_notes.unique_ids: Each restaurant needs unique IDs for menu toggles to prevent JavaScript conflicts
technical_notes.inline_scripts: Menu toggle functions can be inline in the page
technical_notes.CRITICAL_NAVIGATION_FOOTER_RULE: Mobile menu and footer links MUST remain consistent across ALL restaurant articles and point to denversam.com URLs as specified in the 'navigation' and 'footer' sections. DO NOT add individual restaurant links to the navigation or footer when writing new articles. These links match the original WordPress theme and must not change.
